questions.question: What is the primary source of energy for Earth's climate system?

choices.answer: Heat from Earth's interior
The Sun
Electricity generating power plants
Oil & gas

questions.question: Why are greenhouse gases like CO2 & methane important to Earth's climate?

choices.answer: They allow heat from Earth to escape the atmosphere
They trap the Sun's energy so that Earth's surface is warm

imageMetadata.resources: Photo courtesy of National Aeronautics and Space Administration: https://www.nasa.gov/

questions.resources: Photo courtesy of National Aeronautics and Space Administration: https://www.nasa.gov/

questions.question: What happens when CO2 & other greenhouse gases increase in our atmosphere?

choices.answer: Average global temperatures decrease
Average global temperatures increase
The Earth's magnetic field changes direction

questions.resources: Privately hosted; video courtesy of NASA: https://svs.gsfc.nasa.gov/20114

questions.question: A primary reason we know that human activity is causing global warming is:

choices.answer: CO2 has decreased in the atmosphere over the past ten years
Earth's atmosphere is getting thinner
We can correlate the rise of CO2 with human activities
All answer choices are accurate

imageMetadata.resources: GIF courtesy of Scripps Institution of Oceanography, UC San Diego

questions.resources: GIF courtesy of Scripps Institution of Oceanography, UC San Diego

questions.question: These observations inform us that Earth's average temperature is increasing, except:

choices.answer: The 20 warmest years on record have all occurred since 1995
Rising temperatures are melting ice on land, lakes, & sea
Animals are increasing in diversity in the wild.
Winter storms increased in frequency & intensity since 1950

imageMetadata.resources: Photo courtesy of National Oceanographic and Atmospheric Administration: https://cpo.noaa.gov/warmingworld/index.html

questions.resources: Photo courtesy of National Oceanographic and Atmospheric Administration: https://cpo.noaa.gov/warmingworld/index.html

questions.question: The following human activities produce greenhouse gases except:

choices.answer: Driving cars
Walking, biking, & swimming
Animal agriculture
Generating electricity from natural gas, oil, & coal

Photo courtesy of Laurel Zaima & Carolyn Keen

Photo courtesy of Laurel Zaima & Carolyn Keen

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of climate?

choices.answer: An intense thunderstorm in Houston
The average temperature in Chicago over the past 50 years
A hot day in Boston in the fall
A foggy day in San Francisco

questions.resources:
Privately hosted; video courtesy of Utah Education Network: https://www.uen.org/
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qITEZ1zYCLs

questions.question: How do scientists get climate & weather data?

choices.answer: From space, with satellites fitted with special sensors
At the Earth's surface, with thousands of  weather stations
All answer choices are accurate
In the ocean, with autonomous drifters & other instruments

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of weather?

choices.answer: Rainfall averages for Seattle over 40 years
The fact that deserts tend to be hot & dry
A record cold day in Phoenix
There are glaciers in Glacier National Park

questions.question: Will climate change impacts be the same in all locations on Earth?

choices.answer: The results are the same across the globe
There is no scientific evidence to support an answer
The impacts will vary
All answer choices are accurate

questions.question: How does the ozone layer impact life on Earth?

choices.answer: The ozone layer hole is the main reason for climate change
It filters out harmful UV radiation from sunlight
It magnifies sunlight, causing sunburn
Aerosol cans still contain CFCs that thin the ozone layer

imageMetadata.resources: Photo courtesy of the North Carolina Climate Office: https://climate.ncsu.edu/edu/OzoneLayer

questions.resources: Photo courtesy of the North Carolina Climate Office: https://climate.ncsu.edu/edu/OzoneLayer

questions.question: How can we make a difference?

choices.answer: Take the bus, train, or your bike when you can
Eat less meat & dairy
Educate yourself & talk to your friends & family
All answer choices are accurate
